Find tech experiences around you

  • Apr1

    Women in Computing Scholarship

    Apply

    April 1st, 2018

    Dotcom-Moniter is now accepting applications for women pursuing a career in computing to earn a $1000 scholarship.

  • Apr4

    Violence Against Women in the Age of Social Media Panel

    Attend

    April 4th, 2018Center for Intercultural Engagement (144 Curry Student Center)

    For many women, the Internet is not a safe space. Join us along with Amnesty International for this panel in which we will explore this issue and dive into opportunities for action. Dinner will be provided!

  • Apr6

    Google Code Jam

    Participate

    April 6th, 2018

    Code Jam calls on programmers around the world to put their skills to the test by solving multiple rounds of algorithmic puzzles. The international finals this year will be located in Toronto, Canada.

  • Apr7

    HackThePack

    Sign Up

    April 7th - 8th, 2018IV Basement

    A beginner friendly, student run 24 hour hackathon hosted for and by Northeastern students, bringing together COE, COS and CCIS to solve biotech and pharma challenges.

  • Apr13

    PerkinsHacks

    Register

    April 13th - 14th, 2018Perkins School for the Blind in Watertown, MA

    Perkins is hosting its first ever hackathon focused on new, innovative ways to address challenges faced by members of the blind community.

  • Apr13

    Scientista Symposium

    More

    April 13th - 15th, 2018Microsoft Headquarters, NYC

    A 3-day conference for women in STEM fields including workshops, career fair, poster session and more. Use discount code "spring" for 10% off. Scholarships and travel grants can be provided.

  • Apr14

    Hack Dartmouth

    Register

    April 14th - 15th, 2018Dartmouth College

    Dartmouth is hosting their fourth annual hackathon this year. Build something amazing, meet people, and get swag and prizes! Stay tuned for information about chartered busses from Boston.

  • Apr23

    Boston Blockchain Week

    About

    April 23th - 27th, 2018Various locations in Boston area

    Hosted by MIT, Hubspot and more, Boston Blockchain Week brings together founders, researchers, students and investors to explore the evolution of blockchain and cryptocurrency. Check out the blockchain fundamentals developer training bootcamp.

  • Apr24

    Embrace Ambition Summit

    Apply

    April 24th, 2018Lincoln Center, NYC

    The Embrace Ambition Summit is a one-day event focused on overcoming the negative attitudes about ambition in women and addressing other harmful stereotypes that impact gender, race and sexuality. Applications will be reviewed by March 22nd.

  • Apr27

    USC Viterbi CS Preview Day

    Attend

    April 27th, 2018University of Southern California

    Interested in pursuing a doctoral degree in Computer Science? Visit USC's Viterbi school for more information. Applications for travel grants close March 30th.

  • Apr30

    ScholarJet Scholarships

    Details

    April 30th, 2018

    ScholarJet offers scholarships earned through alternative forms such as creating videos. Deadlines coming up for Green Hero and Dream Chaser awards.

  • May18

    Nurse Hackathon 2018- The Opioid Crisis

    More information

    May 18th - 20th, 2018Egan Research Center, NEU

    Listen to panelists present on the latest research related to the opioid epidemic and hack your own solution to the crisis. Contact Prof. Rebecca Love at r.love@neu.edu for possible scholarship opportunities.

  • Jul28

    VMWare CodeHouse

    Apply

    July 28th - 31th, 2018Palo Alto

    Apply for VMWare's multi-day technical experience in Silicon Valley this summer. Chosen applicants will join a team of likeminded female students ready to make an impact and tackle a technical challenge that will give back to the community. Applications are due May 18th.

  • Feb28

    Chart Wescott Scholarship

    Apply

    February 28th, 2019

    A 1000 dollar stipend will be awarded to a high school senior or undergraduate students to assist in their journey to make a positive impact in society through entrepreneurship.
